allBlogs.title: Basics Of Programming
allBlogs.content:
Basics Of Programming >

Ok, i won't be just copy pasting this article from the internet, i'll try to write it on my own.

So what is programming ?

ans : It is the process of creating a set of instructions for the computer so that it knows how to perform a task. Its a basic answer but it's true in whole aspects. Let's take a scenerio, where we tell the computer that "bro, you have to do this task for me" and it'll reply "100010100010111110" and surely we'll not understand what it is saying. Actually computer has its own language ie, binary. We can communicate with it using binary digits, but since we don't know how to communicate in binary, here comes our savior, Programming languages. 

So what does programming language do ?

ans : When we are unable to communicate to the computer in binary digits, programming language come to save us. We can tell the computer through different programming languages, what we want to say and the computer will then understand it and we can then see the output. 

Different types of programming languages :

> There are over 300 types of programming languages that exist as of 2022. Main languages include : C, C++, HTML, Css, Javascript, Python, Ruby, Flutter etc.

Most of them are easy to understand and learn, but some can be really tricky when it comes to learning! If you ever think that "xyz" language is not understandable, just refer to Google. I know it's cheating, but no one is perfect in this world, So don't worry about refering to google, even the best of developers also use google to refer to something. So why can't you ?ðŸ˜‰.

 

 

That's it guys, for this post. Thank you so much for sparing  your time to read this post. Have a nice day!
allBlogs.author: Ansh Bhai
allBlogs.metadesc: Learn the basics of programming in few minutes, i'll teach you how.

allBlogs.title: Latest Technologies In Web Development
allBlogs.content:
Let's Discuss some latest technologies in web development >

We can see that new technologies / frameworks are being released from time to time. But we're gonna count only the helpful and important ones.

1. Progressive Web Apps (PWAs)

Among our list of web development trends, the PWA technology comes first. It’s an app that functions as a website with a full-native mobile app experience. It communicates with clients as a native app and runs independently. It can be really handy when you have to test both mobile based and web based applications.

 

2. Single Page Application (SPA)

SPA is one of the trendy and ruling web development technologies. Unlike conventional website apps, they contain a single page that initially loads the whole website page and then loads the dynamic content on the same page. HTML5 and AJAX are used to make SPAs responsive. These websites are based either on React.js framework or Nuxt js.

3. Accelerated Mobile Pages (AMP)

It is one more trend in the web development industry. The concept of AMP is to accelerate page functionality and retain users. AMP technology works quite similarly to PWA. AMPs are optimized pages that feature a convenient and simplified design with basic features compared to full-scope web products. Moreover, these pages are mobile-responsive, and their content is also readable.

4. AI-Powered Chatbots

In 2022 and beyond, we expect AI-enabled chatbots to become even more versatile in fulfilling the requirements of matching user behaviors by using natural language processing, machine learning, and data retrieval methods. AI-powered chatbots also enhance the client experience. They can accumulate information, fix problems, answer promptly to queries, and all in all, offer a smooth digital experience.

5. Serverless Architecture

The cloud SaaS solutions have maximized this year because of the establishment of work-from-home shifts. Being one of the quickly growing domains, the Web documented a massive increase in the popularity of serverless architecture.

According to the State of the Cloud Report by Flexera, 99% of companies utilize at least one private or public cloud. It shows that cloud architecture is going to be a significant future web development trend.

 

6. Motion UI

Creative web design is another web development trend this year. Startups always focus more on user experience and invest fewer resources in appearance. However, there are more chance of getting notice by promising users if you have a beautifully designed apps and websites. Hence, visual design has become an effective marketing strategy.

7. Mobile-First Development

The rapid increase of mobile users describes why the mobile-first method will massively shape the future of web development. Many web developers have been using this method for years. As per Statista, mobile devices covered more than 57% of webpage views globally in August 2021. Since mobile devices are getting the maximum traffic, using the mobile-first web development approach has become crucial.

 

8. Blockchain Technology

The concept of cryptocurrencies appeared in 2004, and we must expect a lot from this web development technology in 2022 and onwards. Globally, there are almost 80 million blockchain wallet users at the end of Nov 2021. Blockchain technology also needs software and hardware support, trading infrastructure, and legal regulation. Hence, growing web technologies will cover these features in the upcoming years.

 

Bottom Lines

The web development trends discussed above will change how businesses communicate with their clients in 2022 and onwards. Using these technologies will enhance user engagement and help your business stay ahead of the competition.

 

That's it guys, for this post. Thank you so much for sparing your time to read this post. Have a nice day!
allBlogs.author: Ansh Bhai
allBlogs.metadesc: These are the latest technologie in web development

allBlogs.title: Why Every Developer Should Start Blogging
allBlogs.content:
Why every developer should blog like me >

You guys must have listened -> Sharing is caring. That's what our motto, right ? Well yes. So here i am gonna tell you why you should blog if you are a developer and what benefits you'll get from it.

 

There's a long list of reasons why you should have your own blog:

1) By teaching others, you'll become a better programmer. Teaching or explaining concepts to other people will force you to learn more about the topic and organize your thoughts in a more precise way.

 

2) Possibility for making side income through advertising or selling products and services to your readers.

 

3) Your blog has the potential to open the door for networking and business opportunities that you may not have found otherwise.

 

4) Your software career can be greatly enhanced if you can effectively communicate and present your ideas to other people. A coding blog will certainly help you hone those types of skills.

 

5) A coding blog will help you become an authority in your field. Being an authority helps you stand out among other developers and opens the door for leadership roles.

 

Every software developer or coder should have a blog where they share new ideas they have or write guides that help other developers solve the problems they face.

 

That's it guys, for this post. Thank you so much for sparing your time to read this post. Have a nice day!
allBlogs.author: Ansh Bhai
allBlogs.metadesc: Why every web developer should start blogging right now!

allBlogs.title: Why I Started Blogging
allBlogs.content:
Hi reader! I hope you are doing well.

By reading the title, you can guess this post is about "Why is started blogging", isn't it?

Well i'll tell you why i started blogging.

 

Why I Blog? >

Well the answer is really simple. You'll become happy when you have learned a certain skill or mastered in something? isn't it. The same is for me.

I created this blog so that people can know that i have achieved this and i'll also tell that how to excell in a particular field.

By posting regularly, i'll keep a track of what i have done in my past life and what i have learned from that.

So stay tuned and you'll get to know more about meee.
